content.title: Portfolio-v2 (AI Part)
content.description: This project, developed by Théo (aka DevJ2K), corresponds to his personal website. It integrates a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system combined with a Mistral LLM. The system uses data about Théo to answer questions about him.

content.title: SnakeAI
content.description: In this project, Théo implemented reinforcement learning in a snake game. The snake operates with limited vision, and the objective is to learn to reach the longest possible length through trial and error.

content.title: Gomoku
content.description: This project involves developing an AI capable of defeating human players in the game of Gomoku. It relies on the Mini-Max Algorithm with Alpha-Beta Pruning, along with optimization techniques for improved performance.

content.title: LinearRegression
content.description: This project introduces the concept of linear regression. It consists of building a program that predicts car prices based on mileage using a model trained with gradient descent.

content.title: Portfolio-v2 (Web Part)
content.description: This version of Théo's portfolio was built using Nuxt for the frontend and FastAPI for the backend. It provided an opportunity to develop a fullstack application, applying essential software engineering concepts and ensuring secure deployment.
This unreleased project combines all of Théo's skills in AI, design, DevOps, and user data management. It represents a significant milestone in his development journey.

content.title: Drezly
content.description: A SaaS platform designed to empower Vinted resellers with advanced tools to manage and grow their business. Drezly integrates AI-powered features, a Chrome extension, and a comprehensive dashboard.

content.title: Rubik's Cube Solver
content.description: The objective of this project was to create a program capable of solving a Rubik’s Cube in as few moves as possible. Developed in a team of two, Théo focused on the frontend using Vue and Three.js to produce a 3D animated visualization.

content.title: Weather3D
content.description: This is a weather application built using SwiftUI. It features a user-friendly interface and integrates the OpenWeather API. 3D models rendered with SceneKit adapt based on weather and time conditions.

content.title: ScreenTimeApp
content.description: This app was developed to restrict access to selected apps for a defined period, using Apple’s ScreenTime API.

content.title: SwiftyCompanion
content.description: This internal school project uses the 42 API to display various student information. It served as a valuable experience for learning how to work with external APIs effectively.

content.title: Tododev
content.description: This collaborative to-do list app is designed to generate personalized tasks for users using AI. The focus is on adapting tasks to each user's profile and needs.
